title: Design and Innovation - CI3-
text:
The word Engineer (Latin Ingeniator) is derived from the Latin words Ingeniare (‚Äúto contrive, devise‚Äù) and Ingenium (‚Äúcleverness‚Äù).









Give you the basic skills to be able to materialize a conceptual idea into an intermediate mechatronic design object for a given concept.
Learn technologies available at the Lorraine Fab Living Lab.
A scientific and technical culture needed to independently design and build a prototype of a functional mechanical system including a control section.







Idea ‚Üí Mock-up ‚Üí Proof-of-Concept ‚Üí Prototype
To be able to choose the most appropriate design tools.










Prototyping phases and techniques.
Mechanical design:

CAD Modelling
Description of a Kinematic chain
Simulation of a simple movement transformation system

Major components of the

Fablabs and the Social Innovation approach.








Learning by Doing !

La conception de syst√®mes m√©catroniques repose sur un ensemble de technologies (incluant notamment l‚Äôimpression 3D, l‚Äôusinage √† commande num√©rique et l‚Äô√©lectronique programmable) permettant la production de syst√®mes fonctionnels (maquettes, preuves de concepts) en un temps et un co√ªt r√©duit. La maitrise de ces technologies est primordiale afin d‚Äô√™tre capable de choisir les outils les plus adapt√©s en prenant en compte les contraintes sp√©cifiques √† chaque technologie ainsi qu‚Äôau prototype √† r√©aliser.
L‚Äôobjectif du cours est de donner aux √©l√®ves les comp√©tences de base afin de pouvoir mat√©rialiser une id√©e conceptuelle vers un objet de conception interm√©diaire m√©catronique pour un concept donn√©. Ce module utilisera les technologies disponibles au Lorraine Fab Living Lab. A l‚Äôissue du cours, les √©l√®ves auront acquis la culture scientifique et technique n√©cessaire √† la conception et √† la r√©alisation, en autonomie, d‚Äôun prototype de syst√®me m√©canique fonctionnel comportant une partie commande.

text: Prototyping ‚Ä¶ Why it Matters ?

title: Design and Innovation - CI3-
text:
Why Prototyping Matters ?


‚ÄúHumans are really interesting. If you show them your idea in a prototype form, very few people will tell you what‚Äôs right about it. But everybody will tell you what‚Äôs wrong with it.‚Äù


David Kelly, IDEO

title: Design and Innovation - CI3-
text:
What is Prototyping ?
‚ÄúThe process of creating usable artifacts at a variety of fidelities of completion, in order to answer design questions and communicate design ideas; with users in the context of use.‚Äù

title: Design and Innovation - CI3-
text:
What is a Prototype?
We define a prototype as a concrete representation of part or all of an interactive system.
A prototype is a tangible artifact, not an abstract description that requires interpretation.
Designers, as well as managers, developers, customers and end users, can use these artifacts to envision and reflect upon the final system.‚Äù
